intro: Sedum telephium subsp. vulgare, commonly known as stonecrop, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and clusters of star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun, making it a hardy ornamental plant. It is known for its ability to tolerate drought and poor soil conditions, which contributes to its widespread distribution. The showy flowers, which range in color from pink to red, bloom in summer and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
